subject: Re: testing return;
msgSnippet: I am a novice java programmer, so I may be missing something here. The first statement in the method appears to be initializing ctxIn, so it will never be
messageBody:
I am a novice java programmer, so I may be missing something here.
The first statement in the method appears to be initializing ctxIn,
so it will never be equal to null, so neither of the conditions you
are testing for will be true.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Kamal Ahmed <KAhmed@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
>
> In the following method, How do I test if return is being
executed, and
> control returns to the calling method, which in this case is
setAuditContext
>
> public synchronized void setAuditContext(final Stack<LockedValue>
context) {
> Stack<LockedValue> ctxIn = new Stack<LockedValue>();
> ctxIn.addAll(context);
>
> if (ctxIn == null && ctx == null) {
> return;
> }
>
> if (ctxIn == null && ctx != null) {
> ctx = null;
> }
>
> I am also using Coverlipse, but the "return" is not being covered
by the
> following test method:
>
> public void testSetAuditContextSynchronized() {
> UUID key = CONTEXT_OP_KEY;
> AuditLogger subjectAuditLogger = new
> AuditLogger(AUDIT_CATAGORY,
> contextParent, key);
> ctxIn = null;
> try {
> subjectAuditLogger.setAuditContext(ctxIn);
> System.out
> .println("getContext(): " +
> subjectAuditLogger.getContext()); //$NON-NLS-1$
> fail("failed, since npe is thrown");
> subjectAuditLogger.setAuditContext(ctx);
> } catch (NullPointerException npe) {
> System.out.println(npe.getCause());
> System.out.println(npe.getStackTrace());
> // npe.printStackTrace();
> String s = npe.toString();
> System.out.println(s);
> assertEquals
("java.lang.NullPointerException", s);
> subjectAuditLogger.getContext();
> }
>
> }
>
>
> Thanks,
> -Kamal.
>
